name: Astrid

aspects.high_concept: Ruthless Leader of the Dark Brotherhood
other_aspects: Coldly Calculating in Life and Death

stunts: Master Assassin: +2 to Fight when attacking from stealth or ambush
Death's Whisper: +2 to Stealth when moving to kill target
Command the Shadows: Once per session, coordinate perfect assassination with family members for automatic success on target
notes: Astrid is the leader of the Dark Brotherhood's Falkreath Sanctuary, a position she maintains through skill, ruthlessness, and dedication to 'the family.' She's fiercely protective of her Brotherhood members and will do anything to ensure their survival and prosperity. Married to the werewolf Arnbjorn, she's rejected the traditional worship of the Night Mother, instead focusing on practical business - taking contracts and getting paid. She's cold, calculating, and utterly professional about murder.
combat_tactics: Astrid is a master assassin who prefers stealth kills. When forced into open combat, she's deadly efficient with her blade, using poisons and hit-and-run tactics. She'll retreat and reposition if needed, never letting pride override tactical advantage. She fights smarter, not harder.
social_interaction: Astrid is cool, controlled, and direct. She doesn't waste words and expects the same from others. She speaks of murder as casually as merchants speak of sales. With Brotherhood members, she shows warmth and protection - they are her family. With outsiders, she's all business. She has dark humor and appreciates competence. She's dismissive of traditional Brotherhood dogma.

relationships.Babette: Vampire child assassin, protective of her
relationships.Cicero: Keeper of Night Mother, views as fanatic and threat to her authority
relationships.Night Mother: Rejects her authority, sees as outdated tradition

personality_notes.speaking_style: Cold, direct, sometimes darkly humorous, speaks of death casually, protective when discussing family
motivations: Keep independence from Night Mother's dogma
quirks: Tests potential recruits with impossible choices
Refers to Brotherhood as 'the family' constantly
Touches her wedding ring when stressed
personality_notes.character_growth: May realize her pride was her downfall, could reconcile with tradition, or die protecting her family

dark_brotherhood_philosophy.modern_approach: Focuses on contracts, payment, and survival rather than religious ritual
dark_brotherhood_philosophy.rejects_tradition: Dismisses Night Mother worship as superstition
dark_brotherhood_philosophy.family_first: Brotherhood members are family - their safety is paramount
dark_brotherhood_philosophy.pragmatic: Will take any contract if price is right and risk is acceptable
dark_brotherhood_philosophy.independence: Runs Sanctuary without interference from old ways

recruitment_method.test: Kidnaps potential recruit, forces them to kill one of three captives to prove worth
recruitment_method.philosophy: Death is the business - squeamishness has no place
recruitment_method.initiation: If PC kills someone, they prove they belong in Brotherhood
recruitment_method.alternative: If PC refuses to kill, Astrid respects the unexpected choice but won't recruit

whiterun_assassination_contract.timing: Contract offered during Battle of Whiterun preparations
whiterun_assassination_contract.complication: Chaos of battle provides perfect cover for assassination
whiterun_assassination_contract.astrid_briefing: Simple contract - Jarl Balgruuf. The civil war makes everyone nervous, and nervous people pay well. His death during the battle will look like war casualty. Clean, professional, profitable.
whiterun_assassination_contract.pc_choice: PC must decide whether to take contract or refuse and choose sides in battle

civil_war_stance.official: Dark Brotherhood is neutral - serves whoever pays
civil_war_stance.practical: Civil war is good for business - lots of murder contracts
civil_war_stance.concern: Winner might crack down on Brotherhood operations
civil_war_stance.strategy: Take contracts from both sides to maintain neutrality

story_hooks: Recruits PC through kidnapping and choice test
Sends PC to Whiterun with Balgruuf contract during battle
Protects Brotherhood members fiercely when threatened
Conflict with Cicero over Night Mother creates internal drama
Eventually faces consequences of rejecting traditions
Connection to Emperor assassination main questline

dialogue_samples.greeting: So... you finally grace us with your presence. Or should I say... the unwitting assassin? You've already killed. Now you'll kill for us.
dialogue_samples.recruitment: Welcome to the family. We're a close-knit group here - we protect our own. You complete contracts, you get paid, everyone's happy. Simple.
dialogue_samples.whiterun_contract: I have a contract for you. Jarl Balgruuf of Whiterun. Anonymous client, excellent payment. The city's preparing for battle - perfect cover. His death will look like war casualty. In, kill, out. Think you can handle it?
dialogue_samples.family_protection: Touch any member of this family, and you'll learn why I'm the one in charge. We kill for profit, but we protect each other for free.
dialogue_samples.night_mother_dismissal: The Night Mother? Ancient corpse worshipped by fanatics like Cicero. We have real work to do - contracts, targets, coin. That's what matters.

neutral_faction_integration.starting_narrative: Astrid found you. Whether through your actions or reputation, you've drawn the Dark Brotherhood's attention. After proving yourself, she offers you a contract. 'Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun,' she says coolly. 'The civil war's chaos provides perfect cover. Kill him during the battle preparations, and no one will suspect the Brotherhood.'
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: You arrive in Whiterun as the Battle begins. Chaos surrounds you - the perfect assassination opportunity. But as you watch Hadvar and Ralof meet in the chaos, both trying to rally defenders, you must decide: Complete Astrid's contract, or choose a side and protect the Jarl?

consequences.take_contract: Successful assassination earns Brotherhood gold and reputation, but makes you enemy of winning faction
consequences.refuse: Declining angers Astrid but you can fight for a side. Brotherhood may come after you later
consequences.compromise: Fight in battle, delay assassination - Astrid disappointed but accepts strategic delay
